chapter_title: LAW 12 - USE SELECTIVE HONESTY AND GENEROSITY TO DISARM YOUR VICTIM
summary: In Law 12, Robert Greene emphasizes the power of selective honesty and generosity as tools for manipulation. By creating a moment of sincere honesty, one can disarm even the most skeptical individuals, allowing for easier deception. The chapter provides historical examples, such as Count Victor Lustig's con on Al Capone, showcasing how apparent gestures of goodwill can break down defenses. Greene illustrates that practicing kindness can transform the perception of even the most hardened adversaries, turning suspicion into trust. Care must be taken, however, as transparency can lead to distrust if previously established deceit is detected.

slides.section_body: A single act of honesty can overshadow countless dishonest actions. By demonstrating selective honesty, you can disarm even the most distrustful individuals. This unexpected gesture opens the door to manipulation, allowing you to navigate deeper into their vulnerabilities.
slides.quote: One sincere and honest move will cover over dozens of dishonest ones.

slides.section_body: Generosity acts as a Trojan horse, enabling you to craft deception disguised as goodwill. A well-timed gift can disarm your target’s defenses, making them more receptive to your subsequent actions. Generosity lures them into a sense of security.
slides.quote: A timely gift will serve the same purpose.

slides.section_body: Count Victor Lustig demonstrated the art of deceptive charm with his infamous con on gangster Al Capone. By returning Capone’s money with apparent sincerity, Lustig was able to manipulate Capone's perception, shifting him from target to supporter.
slides.quote: My God! You’re honest! If you’re on the spot, here’s five to help you along.

slides.section_body: Your initial interactions set the tone for future relationships. Establishing a reputation for honesty in the beginning lays a strong foundation and creates space for manipulation later. First impressions are hard to shake, offering a key advantage.
slides.quote: Selective honesty is best employed on your first encounter with someone.

slides.section_body: Distraction is the essence of deception. Acts of kindness can divert attention, allowing you to maneuver unnoticed. Use generosity as a tool to soften resistance and create an environment conducive to your later actions.
slides.quote: The essence of deception is distraction.

slides.section_body: Historical figures have employed selective honesty for strategic gains. From Duke Wu's tactics to Odysseus’s Trojan horse, these strategies reveal the timeless nature of deception through perceived honesty. Generosity hides ulterior motives.
slides.quote: A gift brings out the child in us, instantly lowering our defenses.

slides.section_body: While selective honesty can be powerful, it comes with risks. If your motives are uncovered, the consequences can be destructive. Ensure that your gestures appear genuine; otherwise, they may backfire.
slides.quote: If people see through it, their disappointed feelings will become violent hatred.

slides.section_body: Calculated acts of kindness can transform even the toughest opponent into an ally. By appealing to emotions, you can create a vulnerable state in which manipulation becomes easier. The emotional landscape is ripe for deception.
slides.quote: Playing on people’s emotions can turn a Capone into a gullible child.

slides.section_body: A history of deceit will render acts of honesty suspicious. Once trust is broken, playing the honest card can trigger skepticism. Those known for dishonesty must navigate deception with a different approach.
slides.quote: When you have a history of deceit, no amount of honesty will fool people.

slides.section_body: Generosity can cloak ulterior motives, making it a perfect tool in the manipulator's arsenal. An honest façade can cloud judgment, leading targets to underestimate their danger. The art lies in perfecting this guise.
slides.quote: Your guile is hidden inside a magnificent gift.
